title: Coronation Street spoilers: David seeks revenge on rapist Josh during prison riot?
text:
David Platt’s (Jack P Shepherd) not having the best time as of late in Coronation Street, what with him currently stuck in prison, and matters are made much worse when he comes face-to-face to rapist Josh Tucker (Ryan Clayton). However, as a prison riot breaks out, will he perhaps seek revenge on Josh for what he put him through?

In spite of him having to serve time in prison, viewers have seen David being rather optimistic was of late, what with the fact that he’s due out soon.

However, he’s set to come face-to-face with Josh — the man who raped him last year — who ends up in the same prison as him. Viewers will remember that last we saw Josh, David issued him with a warning, before telling him to never return to the Street.

Having Josh in the same prison is no doubt going to be tough for David, but in the coming episodes things will go from bad to worse, as Coronation Street has revealed that — during a prison riot — he’s given the opportunity to exact revenge on Josh.

A riot breaks out, and — determined to stay out of trouble — David heads back to his cell. However, Abe drags Josh into his cell, before handing David a pair of scissors and telling him to do whatever he wants to the rapist.

As David thinks about what to do, he informs Abe that he’d rather deal with Josh on his own.

The question is: what is David planning?

Will he seek revenge for everything that Josh put him through? If so, he risks losing his freedom.

What will transpire?

Coronation Street returns on Wednesday 16th October at 7:30pm and 8:30pm on ITV.
